author: jgm
content:
Not sure where to discuss the Hoodi options, so I figure let's do it here.  For reference: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/hoodi

My view is that we should be building out a network that looks as similar to mainnet as realistically possible, with a bit of additional headroom.  If we look at validators on mainnet right now:

```
Pending: 417
Activating: 394
Active: 1051655
Exiting: 2
Exited: 770114
```

Is it possible to have genesis validators that are already exited?  If so then I'd love to see around 1.1MM active and 800K exited validators at genesis.  Otherwise, 1.1MM+ active to start with seems to make sense.

Regarding amount of ETH in them: again, if we want to be close to mainnet then we should start out with them all being 32 ETH validators with 0x01 credentials (a few with 0x00 ).  We can do some very initial consolidation and compounding for testing, but if we start with lots of 0x02 validators we may find ourselves with a very different configuration to mainnet which would lose some of the validity of using hoodi as a testnet.

author: jgm
content: (And yeah Attestant will be happy to run a chunk of the validators.)

author: pk910
content: The current genesis generator does not allow validators with >32 ETH or in a state other than pending or active

author: jgm
content:
Does that mean that it's technically possible to do, and just requires a bit of tweaking?

There's a good rationale for having a number of exited validators scattered throughout the validators list, in that there has been discusion about validator index reuse in the past and if consolidation is a success we could end up with a ~2MM validator list with only a few hundred thousand active.  That's the type of scenario that we should be ensuring beacon nodes an handle well, and as/when efforts to reduce or reuse the inactive indices comes around we'll have a good testing ground for it.

Exiting the validators post-genesis is possible, but a poor substitute as I don't think we 'll get anywhere near the required level of exited validators any time soon through voluntary exits alone.

author: spartacus_id
content: Hey folks. Quick heads up from Lido: given that Hoodi will go live on Monday, we will be deprecating Lido on Holesky during next week most likely. Primary reason is that it's a huge cost to run it (infra, node operators, oracle operators, DVT etc.), and given the short deadline towards Pectra deployment on Hoodi (10 days) we need to re-focus all our resources and partners' resources on getting everything to work on the new testnet
